column2: SICKofPAIN, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: After 30 years on this for severe migrainesmy Dr. told me ALL doctors will be stopping use of this as a treatment for ALL patients. This is safe & no bad side effects for 30 years! Yet he has been told to switch everyone to NSAIDS- Ibuprofen 600-800mg and a DAILY prescription for a "preventative" type drug that all have bad side effects or worse side effects than the benefits! I looked up every drug & they all have mostly negative patient reviews- very few positives. Yet THIS drug that has ALL positive reviews by patients & ZERO negative reviews is being phased out due to new prescribing protocols! Shows they don't LISTEN to what's really working for the patients!-Not looking foward to being bedridden a few weeks a month!

column2: Smiley, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have horrible sinus/tension headaches and this medication works fast and usually relieves most my pain. I've had surgery for sinus problems, tried many prescribed medications and natural(herbal) ways to find relief. When you can't open your eyes because the light is so unbearable.  Your stomach turning circles and the thought of moving just is not an option.  I found it easier to breath and my headaches ,(most days),are under control thanks to Fiorenol w/ codeine.

column9: It only works for me for 2 hours as well and then doesn't completely get rid of the headache, it just dulls it.  I can only take every 4 hours so by the time I can take another dose the headache has gotten bad enough again that it doesn't do much.  It just dulls it for another 2 hours.

column2: miagrrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had a three day long migraine/extreme tension headache. My doctor prescribed this, and within an hour I had tremendous relief. After a few more doses/24 hours later, headache completely gone with no rebound headache effects. I did not feel impaired in any way, even though it had codeine in it. I felt great, and was able to return to my normal activities. I highly recommend people with intense headaches try this medication!

column2: muffy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this treatment  for 30 years, Originally because of a car accident! Broken head and bad neck and back. Was in a Coma. As I have gotten older my neck, head and back have gotten worse! I also must take neupigen shots because I have idiopathic neutropinia The medication helps with bone pain! It is the only medication than makes my neck,head   and nerves that were damaged bearable.  I only wish after all these years Ins.would allow more than 6 a day,or brand would go down in price so I could afford it.It seems know one seems to know of anything that will work as well, or if there is a higher strength so I could take less. I hope my experiences will help someone get help and be able to live life again!

column9: I have been having migraines and headaches for a very long time. column2: rayemo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This drug combo is amazing.  Due to several auto accidents and chroic mixed migraines /tension headaches that I suffered with for years, I can finally get the relief I need to continue to function. Most Doctors refuse to consider prescribing it and I've had a difficult time getting drug coverage. Not many insurance companies or doctors have a clue what life-altering relief is felt by all of us terminal sufferers of this type of headache. The caps are easy to swallow and I have noticed slight constipation if I have to take a max dose for more than two days in a row without a stool softner. Hope they never stop making Fiorinal available. I can't imagine going back to living in a  darkened room again with a trash can next to the bed in case the nausea got too severe.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Ive had severe migraines since I was 13 (now 43) and as usual, have tried everything.  I have to switch between this medication and Stadol Nasal Spray.  Fioricet works wonders unless the migraine is causing me to vomit.  I would like to see this medication in another form if possible so that it stays in your system when vomiting is an issue.  I also have anxiety issues and this medication helps with that also.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Fioricet w/ codiene for 3 years now. I have very frequent tension headaches and Migraines.Im 23 and have had horrible headaches since i was 13 around that time of the month as did all the females on my mothers side. I have tried lortabs, demoral, topomax, imitrex, treximet, and hundreds more and NOT ONE of them has helped my headaches, only the Fioricets. My mother takes this same medication and she agrees that they kill the pain of headaches and makes you able to carry out the rest of your day and not have to fight a migraine for 2 or 3 days. The only downfall of this medication is how easily you may become dependant on them. If your body is used to taking them and you slow down taking them, you can get an adverse reaction and cause yourself to have a headache or migraine. So if you decide to use this medicine, make sure you only take it when needed. I havent been to the hospital with a migraine in almost 2 years...THANK GOD!!!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I started taking Fioricet/Codeine when I was in my mid 20's for severe headaches/head pain (migraines?).  After suffering for years, the drug was a God-send for me and my family! Unfortunately, after 8 years of gradually increasing usage and my doctor prescribing the medication like candy, I became addicted to it - an experience I would not wish upon anyone!  Afterwards I tried a succession of different medications and treatment approaches.  After 3 or 4 years with no luck, I went back on the Fioricet/Codeine.  I am now in my mid-40's and continue to take the Fioricet/Codeine.  I continue to explore other treatment options, but that is often very discouraging and tiring.  For me, Fioricet/Codeine is the only medication that has worked well to treat the headaches.  Just be very careful to monitor and keep usage in check.  (Note:  Most doctors and pharmacists will tell you that Fioricet and Fiorinal are basically the same - one has tylenol, the other asprin.  For me, Fiorinal is ineffective compared with Fioricet!)
